Name: Signage for pesticide applications in city parks.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to signage for pesticide applications in city parks

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Parks and Recreation
This Introduction was Filed (End of Session)

Attachments.Name: December 19, 2017 - Stated Meeting Agenda with Links to Files

Summary: This bill would require the Department of Parks and Recreation (DPR) to post signs in parks indicating pesticide application in different languages.
Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:
      Section 1. Chapter 1 of title 18 of the administrative code of the city of New York is amended by adding a new section 18-148 to read as follows: 
      �18-148 Signage for pesticide application. a. For the purposes of this section, the term "mandatory language" means English and any covered language, as defined by subdivision j of section 8-1002.
      b. Any sign placed within a property under the jurisdiction of the department regarding pesticide applications shall be posted in all mandatory languages.
      � 2. This local law shall take effect 180 days after its enactment.
KS
10/3/16 
LS 7621






2
